The couple were married at Mills House Hotel in Charleston, S.C., on Saturday evening.
Heidi Michele Brooks and Javit Ahmed Drake were married in Charleston, S.C., last evening. The Rev. Dr. Preston N. Williams, a Presbyterian minister, officiated at Mills House Hotel.

Ms. Brooks, 36, is keeping her name. She is the director of community relations at John Hancock Financial Services in Boston. She graduated from the University of South Carolina and received a master's in international affairs from Johns Hopkins, as well as an M.B.A. from Harvard.

She is a daughter of Beryl Goines of Columbia, S.C., and Joe Brooks of Danbury, Conn. Her father, who is retired, was an associate professor of business at Western Connecticut State University. Her mother is a director of human resources at Richland County School District 1 in Columbia. The bride is a stepdaughter of Willie Goines.

Mr. Drake, 34, a chemical engineer, is a senior researcher at Duracell, the battery company, in Needham, Mass. He graduated from Massachusetts Institute of Technology and received a doctorate in chemical engineering from the University of California, Berkeley.

He is a son of Macarthur Drake Sr. of Gary, Ind., and Dr. Kathleen Glover of Yellow Springs, Ohio. His mother, an internist, specializes in reproductive health and owns clinics in Ohio. His father is a lawyer in Gary. The bridegroom is a stepson of Linda Drake.
